# A/P Vendor Import

Navigate to the menu Vendors -> AP Vendor Import.

<figure><img src="../../../.gitbook/assets/image (56) (1).png" alt=""><figcaption></figcaption></figure>

Click the box “Generate New Vendor ID” to change its value to “Yes” to generate new IDs for the vendors imported into Naviga Ad. Leave the value as "No" when the Vendor IDs are supplied in the import file will be used. This will overwrite existing vendors in the system with matching IDs.

Click the button “Download Template” and an excel sheet displays on your desktop. Fill out the column values according to the section below titled Template. Save the data to your desktop and then click the “Select” button on the Naviga Ad import screen. Browse for the file to upload. Click the “Test Import File” button and the system alerts you to any errors in the spreadsheet.

If there are errors, remove the sheet from the Naviga Ad screen by clicking the x red button. Resave the file and retest the import. Repeat until you get a successful test.

Click the button “Import File” and this uploads the template and vendor IDs into the system. You can view the new vendors when you search for them in the vendor maintenance screen.

2 or 3 letter code, depending upon your setup of countries in Address Setup.</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Phone</td><td>9145453333</td><td>Phone of vendor; format is according to the phone setup in the systems table menu.</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Phone Ext</td><td>333</td><td>Extension</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Fax</td><td>9143454444</td><td>Fax number of vendor format is according to the phone setup in the systems table menu.</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Website</td><td>www.vendor.com</td><td>Vendor web address</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><strong>Vendor Type ID</strong></td><td>XX</td><td>This is the value from the Setup menu -> Vendor Type Setup; must match Naviga Ad values.</td><td>Mandatory</td></tr><tr><td><strong>Terms ID</strong></td><td>N30</td><td>Terms Code ID and must match the Naviga Ad value in the Systems Tables</td><td>Mandatory</td></tr><tr><td><strong>Tax Code</strong></td><td>0</td><td>Tax Code ID and must match the Naviga Ad value in the Systems Tables</td><td>Mandatory</td></tr><tr><td>Withholding Tax Code</td><td>W2</td><td>This is the withholding tax code. If used, value must match Naviga Ad value</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Tax ID</td><td>087654321</td><td>Tax ID of vendor</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>VAT Code</td><td>123</td><td>VAT code as it applies to European clients</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Issue 1099</td><td>Y or N</td><td>Yes or No to issue 1099 or not.</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Account Open Date</td><td>04/10/2019</td><td>Date format entry of the day when the vendor account was opened</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Default GL Account</td><td>01*030*0033</td><td>GL account value which must match a GL account in Naviga Ad.</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Vendor Note</td><td></td><td>Free alphanumeric entry of any vendor related note.</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Payment Priority ID</td><td>H</td><td>Payment priority entry code (free format field, but best to use a set naming convention)</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Payment Status ID</td><td>P</td><td>P, H or S must match one of these values for Pay, Hold or Stop Payment</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Bank ID</td><td>BOA</td><td>Bank ID must match Naviga Ad value in Setup menu for Banks</td><td>Optional</td></tr><tr><td>Contact Name</td><td>Bob Jones</td><td>Name of Vendor contact;
